channel.title: I need help [667]
channel.description:
Hello guys, sorry for the broad title. This is for a 667:
I want to make like a minigame (using one place) for all my players, but so when they tele there they can't see each other, or each other's npcs, or each other's objects, so it's like they're in their own world.
What I need to know is how do I make the players not see each other (when in this place), how to make it so they aren't killing the same npcs, and how to make it so they can't see the same objects (so it can be randomized)... Thanks guys.

item.title: I need help [667]
item.dc:creator: @masan05 masan05
item.description:
@masan05 wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:4, topic:539877”]You should be able to go higher than that, weird, perhaps I’m missing something. You could just assign them a certain NPC to kill and they can’t attack any but that, that way the minigame might also be a bit more social while still keeping the difficulty in place, ie NPC.setTarget(player) then check for the target and make sure they match to the player trying to currently attack it.
Alternatively you could modify the client to allow different height levels and also make it render the scenery properly on every height level too, but that would be a tedious process.[/quote]
Any other alternatives?
I am currently trying to do this (though i dont know how):
Make the objects and npcs viewable by one person (so it only spawns for that person) and then make them like the ::hide command… Any tuts or suggestions on this would be appreciated.

Read full topic

item.title: I need help [667]
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

You should be able to go higher than that, weird, perhaps I’m missing something. You could just assign them a certain NPC to kill and they can’t attack any but that, that way the minigame might also be a bit more social while still keeping the difficulty in place, ie NPC.setTarget(player) then check for the target and make sure they match to the player trying to currently attack it.
Alternatively you could modify the client to allow different height levels and also make it render the scenery properly on every height level too, but that would be a tedious process.

Read full topic

item.title: I need help [667]
item.dc:creator: @masan05 masan05
item.description:
@masan05 wrote:

Pure_:

Spawn them and their NPCs on different height levels, this is how Jad is done in DeltaScape (and its derivatives).

Would this work for a place that is already made?
Like, for example:
I want to use varrock, would this work?

-----Edit-----
Also, i can only go to height level 3

Read full topic

item.title: I need help [667]
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

Spawn them and their NPCs on different height levels, this is how Jad is done in DeltaScape (and its derivatives).

Read full topic

item.description:
@masan05 wrote:

Hello guys, sorry for the broad title. This is for a 667:

I want to make like a minigame (using one place) for all my players, but so when they tele there they can’t see each other, or each other’s npcs, or each other’s objects, so it’s like they’re in their own world.

What I need to know is how do I make the players not see each other (when in this place), how to make it so they aren’t killing the same npcs, and how to make it so they can’t see the same objects (so it can be randomized)…
Thanks guys.
